ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard macros
ygData.msgSnippet: ... For my cleric, for my healing hotkeys, I add a: /g Greater Healing %t Not only is this useful when there s another healer in the group, it s good group
ygData.messageBody:
At 03:40 PM 11/16/00 -0600, Mott, Mike J. wrote:
>Actually, my favorite for my druid is hotkeys 1-8 with the following
>
>/sit off
>/cast #

For my cleric, for my healing hotkeys, I add a:

/g Greater Healing %t

Not only is this useful when there's another healer in the group, it's good
group communication.

>That is it...and it is immensley helpful...hot key 9 is the sit/stand button
>and hotkey 10:
>
>/sit off
>/doability # (forage)
>/sit on

Just don't accidentally press this while you're kiting. :-)

For my bard, I when I am charming a mob while grouped, I'll add a:

/g Charming %t
/cast <charm>

and another hot key for the attack:

/g Pet attack %t
/pet attack

I suppose with all the extra socials, I may add a bank where instead of
"groupsay" it'll be regular "say". It's helpful when I happen to be running
by someone who is in trouble.

---Windleaf
